questions.question: For the wave function y = 0.3 sin(4x - 20t), what is the amplitude?
questions.explanation: In y = A sin(kx - ωt), A is the amplitude. Here A = 0.3 m

questions.question: In the wave equation y = 0.5 cos(2πx - 8πt), what is the wave number k?
questions.explanation: Wave number k = 2π/λ. In y = A cos(kx - ωt), k is the coefficient of x, so k = 2π rad/m

questions.question: For y = 0.4 sin(3x - 12t), what is the angular frequency ω?
questions.explanation: Angular frequency ω is the coefficient of t in (kx - ωt), so ω = 12 rad/s

questions.question: Given y = 0.2 cos(5x - 15t), what is the frequency in Hz?
For y = 0.6 sin(8x - 24t), what is the wavelength?
In y = 0.25 cos(10x - 30t), what is the wave speed?
Which wave equation represents a wave traveling to the right?
questions.explanation: Waves travel in the +x direction when the equation has form (kx - ωt) or (ωt - kx) with proper sign arrangement

questions.question: For y = 0.8 sin(2πx/3 - 4πt), what is the period?
questions.explanation: ω = 4π rad/s, T = 2π/ω = 2π/(4π) = 0.5 s

questions.question: If y = A sin(kx - ωt + φ), what does φ represent?
questions.explanation: φ is the phase constant, which determines the initial displacement at x=0, t=0

questions.question: Given y = 0.3 cos(6x - 18t + π/2), what is the displacement at x=0, t=0?
For y = 0.5 sin(4x - 16t), what is the maximum particle speed?
questions.explanation: v_max = Aω = 0.5 × 16 = 8 m/s (particle speed, not wave speed)

questions.question: Which equation has the same wavelength as y = 2 sin(5x - 10t)?
questions.explanation: Same k value (5 rad/m) means same wavelength λ = 2π/k

questions.question: For y = 0.4 cos(2πx - 8πt), what is the wave number?
questions.explanation: k = 2π rad/m (coefficient of x in the cosine argument)

questions.question: If y = 0.6 sin(3x - 12t) represents a wave, what is its frequency?
What is the phase difference between y₁ = 2 sin(4x - 8t) and y₂ = 2 sin(4x - 8t + π)?
questions.explanation: Phase difference = π radians, meaning the waves are completely out of phase (180° apart)

questions.question: For y = 0.7 cos(5x - 25t), what is the particle acceleration at maximum displacement?
Which parameter determines how many wave cycles fit in 2π meters?
questions.explanation: Wave number k represents the number of radians per meter, so k/2π gives cycles per meter

questions.question: For y = 0.9 sin(2x - 6t + π/4), what is the displacement at x=0.5 m, t=1 s?
If two waves have equations y₁ = 3 sin(4x - 12t) and y₂ = 3 sin(4x - 12t + π/2), they are:
questions.explanation: Phase difference = π/2 radians = 90°, so they are quarter-cycle out of phase

questions.question: What is the relationship between angular frequency ω and period T?
questions.explanation: Angular frequency ω = 2πf and f = 1/T, so ω = 2π/T

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You have mastered wave function analysis and can extract all parameters from sine/cosine equations!
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand the main concepts but should practice more with phase constants and calculations.
scoreMessages.50: You're making progress! Focus on identifying k, ω, A in different equation forms.
scoreMessages.0: Review the standard wave equation form y = A sin(kx - ωt + φ) and what each parameter represents.
